clinical_study.brief_title: Detection of Human Papillomavirus in Polymerase Chain for Suspicious Lesions of the Amygdala: Concordance Smear-Biopsy
clinical_study.official_title: Detection of Human Papillomavirus in Polymerase Chain for Suspicious Lesions of the Amygdala: Concordance Smear-Biopsy

brief_summary.textblock: Multicentre prospective study of concordance between two tissue sampling modes (smear / biopsy), which applies the same diagnostic method (PCR).

primary_outcome.measure: the correlation between the two sampling methods
primary_outcome.description: the correlation between the two sampling methods (smear and biopsy), defined by the probability of positive correlation and the negative concordance probability.

secondary_outcome.measure: rate of concordance for the detection of HPV between biopsy and smear

secondary_outcome.description: the overall agreement, assessed by kappa Cohen.

arm_group.arm_group_label: patient with suspected lesions of the tonsillar region
arm_group.description: patients will have a tonsil biopsy and a smear

intervention.description: Biopsies were obtained during endoscopy of Aero-Digestive Tract Superior under general anesthesia.
intervention.arm_group_label: patient with suspected lesions of the tonsillar region

intervention.description: The smears are made in consultation a fortnight before performing endoscopic examination. They are carried out after a local anesthetic spray in order to optimize the number of cells collected.
intervention.arm_group_label: patient with suspected lesions of the tonsillar region

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presents a suspicious lesion of the amygdala region
- Have a biopsy of the oropharynx planned in the operating room.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant Patient.
- Against anesthetic or surgical indication for endoscopy of the upper aerodigestive tract.
